Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

::Lord Elder::

Elder was running towards Relay when he saw a Predacon flier overhead. Elder assumes that it must be a scout moving ahead of the pack. Elder takes cover under some trees.

Elder: Lord Elder: Maximize!

Elder transforms to bot mode and draws his tail bow blaster/cannon. He takes aim at the flier and shoots off three energy rounds.

He opens a channel at the same time.

Elder: Elder to Deadfur: the Predacons are close. I'm engaging their scout.

Nic <warriorazure@...> wrote:                                  The Predacon strike team was nearing the Silver Wing air space, yet
 they sensed something was wrong there. Normally, had they detected
 them, the Maximals should have been coming along now,but nothing of
 that happened. True, Motherload's ECM suite was powerful enough to
 mask them, but Jotunn figured something else was going.
 
 Jotunn: Gunrain, I need a quick survey of Relay. Scout ahead, but do
 not engage yet.
 
 Gunrain: Aww, not even a missile, boss?
 
 Jotunn: Nothing, or I rip your motherboard and fry it before I toss
 your empty hulk to the Minions. Understood?
 
 Gunrain: Uh... Sir, yeas, Sir!
 
 He boosted towards the city at ludicrous speed, activating his long
 range radar as he did. In less time than it took to say it, he had a
 complete survey of the fighting going on. He headed back to the main
 formation.
 
 Gunrain: Wow, Ma Lord! You didn't tell us there was Wave 1 an' a ha'f!
 Wooeeh! Those maxis are really gettin' spanked!
 
 He transmitted the data to the others in the squadron.
 
 Jotunn: I didn't tell you because there is no such thing. That is not
 one of us. Does any of you recognize this thing?
 
 Lock-on: It doesn'T look Minion, but something older... Decepticon
 perhaps...
 
 Jotunn: Let's find out. You! [He pointed to one of the escorts] Go to
 that huge robot and tell him I want to know who he is and what is his
 allegiance.
 
 The escort left...
 
 --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <warriorazure@...> wrote:
 >
 > Deadfur: Just great... How about a Minion attack while everyone else's
 > at it?
 > 
 > He opened the Maximal only frenquency.
 > 
 > Deadfur: Troops, this is Deadfur speaking. We have a report of another
 > wave of Preds coming in. We have to get rid of that giant bug before
 > they get here, unless some of you can manage to turn him the other way
 > around. For now, continue with hit-and-run. Try to sneak up on him and
 > to plant some bombs there. Engineering, how's the shield comin' up?
 > 
 > Officer: Slowly, commander. We don't have the city covered yet, but we
 > do have defenses over the gravitaion nullifiers. It will take a lot
 > before they shoot us down from the skies.
 > 
 > Deafur: Good, keep working on it. Keep up the efforts, soldiers!
 > 
 > The small fliers were buzzing quickly around Skorponok, strafing him
 > with lasers and missiles, while higher up, a team was trying a "rock
 > drop" technique. They were miles high above the Decepticon and
 > dropping small but heavy bombs that would generate a bigger impact
 > because of the altitude...
 > 
 > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@> wrote:
 > >
 > > ::Lord Elder::
 > > 
 > > Elder thinks over this change in events before opening a return
 > channel to Deadfur.
 > > 
 > > Elder: You're not going to like it. I'm showing what appears to be a
 > whole squadren of fliers and probably more coming your way. Since you
 > are on site and assisting the Maximals I'm scrapping the 'no
 > interference' order. I'm on my way and I'll try and get as much back
 > up as possible.
 > > 
 > > Elder switches to an open Watcher channel.
 > > 
 > > Elder: Watchers, this is Lord Elder. One of our ranks is directing
 > the defense of the Maximal City Relay. They are faced with a
 > Decepticon attack and a coming Predacon assualt. They are to recieve
 > are full aid. I'm going there myself. Elder out.
 > > 
 > > He closes communications and heads for the exit. Only Watchers know
 > how to survive the harsh lands around their base. Avoid them.
 > > 
 > > Elder leaves Cryonosis in a small shuttle pod that will get him to
 > the main land.
 > > 
 > > Nic <warriorazure@> wrote:                                 
 > Deadfur got the message on the Watchers-only frequency. He was not too
 > >  pleased with the news. As soon as he could, he opened a line with
 > >  Cryonosis.
 > >  
 > >  Deadfur: Deadfur reporting. I'm assisting the Maxies in Relay as per
 > >  emergency protocols and I'm directing the defenses against that
 brute.
 > >  I require further instructions and backups, my Lord. Oh, and just how
 > >  large is that coming Pred force?
 > >  
 > >  He ducked as something blew up nearby.
 > >  
 > >  --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@> wrote:
 > >  >
 > >  > ::Lord Elder::
 > >  > 
 > >  > Deep within The Watcher headquarters signals go off, waking the
 > >  Watcher leader.
 > >  > 
 > >  > Elder: What in the hell?
 > >  > 
 > >  > He checks the monitoring systems that The Watchers have set up
 > >  around the planet.
 > >  > 
 > >  > Elder: One of the Predacon camps looks like their mobalizing to
 > >  attack Relay. Wonderful. Sometimes I think The Minions are easier to
 > >  deal... What's this?
 > >  > 
 > >  > Elder locks onto a new signature.
 > >  > 
 > >  > Elder: It's Decepticon, but not a normal Con signal. Something new.
 > >  Something different.
 > >  > 
 > >  > He opens a comm to his men.
 > >  > 
 > >  > Elder: Watchers: I believe a new twist in these Beast Wars has
 > >  happened. I want Watchers at Relay ASAP. Do not get involved unless I
 > >  order it but I want to study the battle there. Right now the Silver
 > >  Wing Maximals are dealing with some kind of new Decepticon but it
 > >  appears that Predacons are moving to attack as well. Elder out.
 > >  > 
 > >  >        
 > >  > ---------------------------------
 > >  > Boardwalk for $500? In 2007? Ha! 
 > >  > Play Monopoly Here and Now (it's updated for today's economy) at
 > >  Yahoo! Games.

 > Yahoo! FareChase.
 > >
 >
